Indonesia to Cut ASEAN Import to Make Room for $15 Billion US Energy
body: Indonesia says it is also open to importing less energy from other sources such as the Middle East and Africa.

title: OJK Orders Listed Firms to Lift Public Shares to 15% or Face Delisting
body: Indonesia’s market regulator will require listed firms to lift public ownership to 15% within two years or risk delisting.

title: Indonesia Swallows US Poison Pill in New Trade Deal as Trump Isolates China
body: The US has threatened to terminate the tariff deal if Indonesia makes a deal with a country that "jeopardizes" Washington's interests.

title: OJK Fines Stock Influencer Rp 5.35 Billion for Share Price Manipulation
body: OJK fined a social media stock influencer Rp 5.35 billion for manipulating share prices through misleading online posts.

title: Lawmakers, Industry Question Indonesia’s Rp 25 Trillion Car Import Plan
body: Indonesia’s plan to import Rp 25 trillion in vehicles from India is drawing criticism from industry and lawmakers over jobs and capacity.

title: Rupiah Edges Up 6 Points as US-Indonesia Tariff Deal Lifts Sentiment
body: Rupiah closes at Rp 16,888, up 6 points, after Indonesia-US tariff signing, despite hawkish Fed tone and strong US data.

title: JCI Holds Steady as Global Tensions Offset US Tariff Deal Boost
body: JCI closed down 0.03% at 8,271 as global geopolitical tensions offset optimism over the finalized 19% US tariff agreement.

title: Market Must Absorb $11 B in Shares to Meet 15% Free Float: IDX
body: IDX estimates $11 billion in additional shares must be absorbed as 267 listed firms fall short of the 15% free float rule.

title: Freeport Signs Deal to Extend Grasberg Operations
body: Freeport secures life-of-mine extension at Grasberg, commits 12% stake divestment by 2041 and boosts Papua development support.

title: Indonesia’s Balance of Payments Swings to $7.8 Billion Deficit in 2025
body: Indonesia posted a $7.8 billion balance of payments deficit in 2025, reversing a surplus a year earlier amid global risk pressures.

title: Indonesia Still Plans to Buy 50 Boeing Jets Under Reciprocal Trade Deal, Rosan Says
body: Indonesia is still negotiating a plan to buy 50 Boeing jets as part of a broader reciprocal trade deal with the United States.

title: US Scraps Non-Trade Clauses From Tariff Deal, Indonesia Says
body: Indonesia says the US has removed clauses related to nuclear reactors and South China Sea.

title: Risk or Reward? Economists Weigh Impact of US Reciprocal Tariffs on Indonesia
body: Economists says US reciprocal tariffs pose 2026 growth risks but could boost exports and FDI if the deal proves exclusive.

title: Antam Gold Jumps to Rp 2.94 Mill as Global Prices Gain on US-Iran Tensions
body: Antam gold jumped Rp 28,000 to Rp 2,944,000 as global prices firmed on US-Iran tensions and ahead of key US inflation data.

title: US Tariffs on Indonesia Stay at 19%, But Textile Gets 0%
body: Washington's 0% tariff rate quota will benefit 4 million workers in Indonesia's textile sector,  senior minister Airlangga says.

title: JCI Climbs 0.31% Amid BI Rate Pause, US-Indonesia Tariff Deal
body: JCI rose 0.31% to 8,300 as BI held rates at 4.75%, credit growth hit 9.96%, and US cut tariffs on Indonesian goods to 19%.

title: Government’s Ramadan Push Supports Q1 Growth, but Not Structural Recovery
body: With household consumption accounting for more than half of GDP, festive spending can meaningfully lift short-term growth.

title: Prabowo Courts US Investors, Oversees $38.4b Business Agreements During Washington Visit
body: Indonesia and US firms signed $38.4b in MoUs as Prabowo pressed for a trade deal and urged American investors to back local production.

title: Indonesia Extends Freeport Mining Permit to 2041 and Mine Life
body: Indonesia extends Freeport’s mining permit to 2041 and secures a larger stake, ensuring long-term output and state revenue.

title: Caution Over BI Policy Drags JCI Down 36 Points at Close
body: JCI closed down 0.43% at 8,274 as investors awaited BI’s rate decision, with heavy trading and mixed global cues shaping market sentiment.
